body_html: @erogol I know what's going on. For reasons I'm not understanding, librosa pads the window to same length as nfft here. So it would get ceil(224960 - 2048) / 275) = 811 with center=False, and ceil(224960 / 275) = 819 for center=True.
body_text: @erogol I know what's going on. For reasons I'm not understanding, librosa pads the window to same length as nfft here. So it would get ceil(224960 - 2048) / 275) = 811 with center=False, and ceil(224960 / 275) = 819 for center=True.
body: @erogol I know what's going on. For reasons I'm not understanding, `librosa` pads the window to same length as `nfft` [here](https://github.com/librosa/librosa/blob/a41361c6629e5163f162bd2e20399b886812f714/librosa/core/spectrum.py#L152-L153). So it would get `ceil(224960 - 2048) / 275) = 811` with `center=False`, and `ceil(224960 / 275) = 819` for `center=True`.
